stimulusHtml: The Romantic movementâ€™s increased emphasis on the importance of emotional bonds is best understood in the context of which eighteenth-century social development?

features.html: The following question refers to the topic of Romanticism.

choicesHtml: The growing economic influence of the commercial classes associated with the expansion of trade
Increased resources devoted to child-rearing and a growing emphasis on education
Growth of urban populations associated with rising productivity
Greater social mobility associated with economic change
